name: places/ChIJT7L7vw72wokRUdmYsb4rLR8
formattedAddress: 24 E 120th St, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 24 E 120th St, New York, NY 10035-2737, USA

originalText.text: Please do not attend this school if you work a 9-5 job. This school does not accommodate working individuals. Evening classes are pretty much non-existent. Majority of the classes are early morning and early afternoon. If you ask the staff upon applying, they will tell you there are evening classes; so please take heed of my advice.

text.text: Please do not attend this school if you work a 9-5 job. This school does not accommodate working individuals. Evening classes are pretty much non-existent. Majority of the classes are early morning and early afternoon. If you ask the staff upon applying, they will tell you there are evening classes; so please take heed of my advice.

originalText.text: I completed my program back in 2020. At the time I think it was worth the suffering for 12 months, but in my opinion I wouldn't attend with the new extended time. The office staff was rude and nasty. The professors however were very nice. My friend currently attends the college and the program isn't an issue but no one is responsive to emails and STILL the office staff is rude and nasty. I've heard nurses eat their young, but HFCN starts munching at them before they even leave nursing school. Good luck

originalText.text:
I honestly don't understand the
bad reviews..yet they have issues , but it is a decent school that has been teaching nurses for decades now..I worked with some of those nurses, some my supervisor,DNS..etc..Nursing schools are never easing. I m currently attending the school and yes, it is challenging but durable.The teachers are good  some betters than the others, but overall they are good..You learned a lot, the program is intensive you have do your part and study hard..period..People just like to criticise for the keck of it..most are bad students.

originalText.text: I’m currently attending Helene fuld and I must say the school is great. The professors are very helpful and understanding. Some will say it’s hard but nursing is suppose to be tough, I never heard a story where they say nursing school is a breeze. Although it’s tough it’s doable, with hard work.

text.text: I’m currently attending Helene fuld and I must say the school is great. The professors are very helpful and understanding. Some will say it’s hard but nursing is suppose to be tough, I never heard a story where they say nursing school is a breeze. Although it’s tough it’s doable, with hard work.

originalText.text:
HORRIBLE SCHOOL
currently in the LPN-RN bridge program and expected to graduate in May 2020. The school is unorganized and looks for ways to get money out of students by adding last minute books, online programs and other requirements needed to pass.Whatever they say tuition is it is not! they are hidden add on fees as the semester progresses. Make sure to watch your fin aid package money WILL go missing and they will charge you extra money in your tuition bill. President of the school was fired from her last job for stealing school funds so be wary.
Classes are a joke and they teach you absolutely nothing and do NOT prepare you for NCLEX. Professors are rude and condescending. You will wonder what you are paying money for going to this school. take my advice and go to a cheaper program where the school actually CARES about you being a nurse. not just a means for their next bonus
